iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Antigua and Barbuda
iati-activity.description: Embassy covers the participation costs of seven representatives of environmental and fisher folk organizations from Antigua and Barbuda, Belize, Grenada Mexico and Saint Kitts and Nevis to the 2010 Fishersâ Forum âCapacity development in fisher organisations: involving researchers and managersâ that is part of the GMA Regional Fishersâ Summit at the 63rd Gulf and Caribbean Fisheries Institute (GCFI) meeting. During the Summit one of the regionâs fishers will receive the Gladding Memorial Award recognizing fishers who demonstrate commitment to the sustainable use and conservation of marine resources. At the Fisherâs Forum local fishers from Puerto Rico will gather with GMA award winners from previous years to discuss how to achieve sustainable fisheries. The Fishers participating with the Embassy's funding are GMA winners from previous years.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Antigua and Barbuda
iati-activity.description: Mount Obama National Park, recently designated a protected area by the government of Antigua & Barbuda, comprises the highest peak on the twin island state and is home to an array of fauna and flora. The goal of this project is to rehabilitate and develop trails within Mount Obama National Park to facilitate viewing and appreciation of bird species that inhabit park and surrounding areas. This will mark the formal genesis of birding eco-tourism in the twin-island state and will create a means of employment for persons from the surrounding villages. By raising the profile of birds that inhabit the area, the aim is also to enhance their conservation by locals and visitors alike.
